Intervention: The motivational intervention group: The participants in the intervention group are a brief motivational intervention of a session administered by a psychologist. This intervention consists of a single motivational interview adapted from 20 to 30 minutes, based on the principles of the transtheorical model and on the manual of motivational therapy. It is carried out by the same psychologist, trained and supervised for this type of intervention.

Participants in this group were given a brief educational advice (10 minutes maximum; only on the health consequences of alcohol and tobacco use) and received a brochure on the health effects of alcohol and tobacco use.
Eligibility: Women with primary breast cancer, with no ongoing support for alcohol and other drug use.
AUDIT-C score >1 or more than one cigarette smoked per day.
People who were able to consent to the intervention stressed the use of alcohol and other drugs (Karnofsky index > 70).
Patients who are currently using substances for which second-line therapy is already being initiated.
Results: Number of patients with an individual decrease in tobacco consumption at 3 months
Individual decrease of 20% in AUDIT score (identification test for alcohol use disorders) observed at 3 months
The AUDIT test measures alcohol consumption and describes its profiles. Its score ranges from 0 (no consumption) to 28 (dependence on alcohol).
